articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has vowed to fight on after seeing his side thrashed by Newcastle in the EFL Cup fourth round.
articles.title: Ten Hag vows to 'fight on' - but 'questions' grow for Man Utd boss

articles.description: Declan Rice endures a nightmare return to West Ham as Arsenal are dumped out of the EFL Cup in the fourth round following a 3-1 defeat at the London Stadium.
articles.title: West Ham dump below-par Arsenal out of EFL Cup

articles.description: Phillipe Clement continues his unbeaten start as Rangers manager with a dominant 5-0 Scottish Premiership victory at Dundee in a disrupted and delayed game.
articles.title: Rangers hammer Dundee in twice-delayed contest

articles.description: The story behind England's 2003 World Cup elimination, which was partly because of their decision not to play Zimbabwe in Harare.
articles.title: When politics derailed England's World Cup campaign

articles.description: Last season's runners-up Newcastle play at Chelsea in the Carabao Cup quarter-finals, while Liverpool face West Ham.
articles.title: Chelsea to play Newcastle in EFL Cup quarter-finals

articles.description: EFL Cup holders Manchester United suffer another damaging defeat at Old Trafford after Newcastle knock them out in the fourth round.
articles.title: Superb Newcastle knock holders Man Utd out of EFL Cup

articles.description: Eddie Jones insists he has no regrets about resigning as Australia head coach after less than a year in charge.
articles.title: Jones insists he has no Australia exit regrets

articles.description: Polish second seed Iga Swiatek moves within touching distance of WTA Finals last four after a confident win against US Open champion Coco Gauff.
articles.title: Swiatek beats Gauff to close on WTA Finals last four

articles.description: South Africa are on the brink of clinching a World Cup semi-final berth after thrashing New Zealand by 190 runs.
articles.title: South Africa thrash New Zealand to close on semis

articles.description: South Africa are on the brink of clinching a World Cup semi-final berth after a 190-run thrashing of New Zealand in Pune.
articles.title: South Africa beat New Zealand by 190 runs
